name.description: Machine readable name of the analysis (no spaces, random characters, etc).

output_variables.title: output_variables
output_variables.description: List of the output variables that is expected. Objective functions will be flagged in the list.

display_name.description: Display name of the output variable. This can be set to be whatever the user wants.

display_name_short.description: A shorter version of the display name. This is user defined and helps with creating short names for plots.

name.description: Machine friendly name of the output variable. This must match an output of the OpenStudio workflow (e.g., openstudio_results.electricity_ip)

units.description: Units of the output variable. This is only used for display purposes.

objective_function.description: Boolean to specify that the output variable is part of an objective function.

objective_function_index.description: Index of the objective function. Zero-based.

objective_function_target.description: Target value which the objective function is trying to achieve.

scaling_factor.description: Value by which to scale this output variable.

objective_function_group.description: If grouping objective functions, then the index which this output variable is grouped.

metadata_id.description: Deprecated. Use to store a universal metadata ID for DEnCity.

visualize.description: Boolean to specify that the output variable will be visible in OpenStudio Server's visualizations.

export.description: Boolean to specify that the output variable will be exported to tabular data when using OpenStudio Server.

variable_type.description: The data type of the variable.

weather_file.description: Weather file to be used in the anlaysis.

worker_initialization.description: Worker init script that runs on each worker before the analysis starts.

worker_finalization.description: Worker finalization script that runs after each worker finishes running the batch of simulations for the analysis.

file_format_version.description: Version of the OSA. This is only 1 at the moment.

gemfile.description: set to true to use Gemfile

problem_def.title: problem
problem_def.description: Definition of the problem to analyze.

analysis_type.description: The type of analysis to run.

name.description: Name of the problem being analyzed. This does not appear to be used.

workflow.title: workflow
workflow.description: The steps the problem will follow.

design_alternatives.description: If running design alternative based workflows (from PAT local), then use this workflow definition.

name.description: Name of the design alternative (this is seen by the user).

description.description: Description of the design alternative set by the user.

measure_name.description: Name of the measure as defined in the measure.rb file.

name.description: Name of alternative option. This is user-defined.

description.description: Description of alternative option. This is user-defined.

boundary.description: PSO: Options: invisible, damping, reflecting, absorbing2007, absorbing2011, default

bfgs.description: RGenoud: Use Bounded Gradient Search. Options: 1 or 0 (True or False)

bfgsburnin.description: RGenoud: The number of generations which are run before the BFGS is ï¬rst used

check_boundary.description: Morris: Force variables to respect mins/maxes. Options: 1 or 0 (True or False)

cidx.description: SPEA2: Crossover Distribution Index (large values give higher probabilities of offspring close to parent)

conf.description: Sobol: the confidence level for bootstrap confidence intervals

debug_messages.description: 0 - do not show debug messages. 1 - show debug messages.

elitism.description: Ga, GaIsl: Number of best fitness individuals to survive at each generation

epsilon_gradient.description: Ga, GaIsl, RGenoud: Epsilon in gradient calculation

experiment_type.description: DOE: Options: full_factorial; Diag: Options: diagonal TODO: only one, conflicts with DOE

exit_on_guideline_14.description: Exit on Guideline 14: 0 (off), 1 (both electric and gas), 2 (just electric), 3 (just gas)

failed_f_value.description: Value to set the return value if a simulation fails.

generations.description: NSGA2, RGenoud, SPEA2: Number of generations

grid_jump.description: Morris: Integer specifying the number of levels that are increased/decreased for computing the elementary effects

lambda.description: PSO: [0,1] a percentage to limit the maximum velocity (Vmax) for each dimension

levels.description: Morris: Positive integer (if individual, total simulations is this times each variable). Must be at least 2

M.description: fast99: integer specifying the interference parameter, i.e. the number of harmonics to sum in the Fourier series decomposition

maxFitness.description: Ga, GaIsl: Upper bound on the fitness function after that the GA search is interrupted

maxfn.description: PSO: Maximum number of function evaluations

maxit.description: Optim, PSO: Maximum number of iterations

maxiter.description: Ga, GaIsl: Maximum number of iterations to run before the GA search is halted

max_queued_jobs.description: Integer specifying the maximum number of queued jobs

method.description: PSO: TODO; optim: TODO: This is fixed for optim and conflicts with PSO

midx.description: SPEA2: Mutation Distribution Index (large values give higher probabilities of offspring close to parent)

mu_dist_idx.description: NSGA2: Mutation Distribution Index (large values give higher probabilities of offspring close to parent)

n.description: fast99: Integer giving the sample size, i.e. the length of the discretization of the s-space

nboot.description: Sobol: The number of bootstrap replicates

norm_type.description: fast99, Ga, GaIsl, Morris, optim, PSO, RGenoud, Sobol, SPEA2

npart.description: PSO: Number of particles in the swarm

numIslands.description: GaIsl: Integer value specifying the number of islands to be used in a ring topology in which each island is connected unidirectionally with another island

migrationRate.description: GaIsl: Value in range 0-1 providing the proportion of individuals that should migrate between the islands

migrationInterval.description: GaIsl: Integer value specifying the number of iterations at which exchange of individuals takes place

order.description: Sobol: the maximum order in the ANOVA decomposition (all indices up to this order will be computed)

pgtol.description: Optim, RGenoud: Tolerance on the projected gradient

popSize.description: Ga, GaIsl: Size of initial population TODO: similar to RGenoud

pcrossover.description: Ga, GaIsl: Probability of crossover between pairs of chromosomes. Typically a large value

pmutation.description: Ga, GaIsl: Probability of mutation in a parent chromosome. Usually a small probability

p_power.description: fast99, Ga, GaIsl, Morris, NSGA2, Optim, PSO, RGenoud, Sobol, SPEA2: Lp norm power (must be non-negative)

r.description: Morris: Integer giving the number of repetitions of the design

r2.description: Morris: Integer giving the size of the (bigger) population in which is extracted the design, for the space-filling improvement by (Campolongo et al. 2007).  r2 > r

r_genoud_debug_flag.description: RGenoud: debug flag Options: 1 or 0 (True or False)

random_seed.description: Sobol first seed for random number generator.

random_seed2.description: Sobol second seed for random number generator.

run.description: Ga, GaIsl: Number of consecutive generations without any improvement in the best fitness value before the GA is stopped

run_all_samples_for_pivots.description: preflight: Run all Samples for Pivots Options: true or false.

run_baseline.description: Diag: Run Baseline Options: 1 or 0 (True or False)

run_max.description: preflight: run max Options: true or false.

run_min.description: preflight: run min Options: true or false.

run_mode.description: preflight: run mode Options: true or false.

sample_method.description: The type of sampling. If 'all_variables' then the sampling will occur across all the variables. If individual, then each variable is sampled individually.

seed.description: Seed value for random number generators. If null then algorithm will choose random seed.

solution_tolerance.description: RGenoud: Numbers within solutionTolerance are considered equal

topology.description: PSO: Options: gbest, lbest, vonneumann, random

type.description: Sobol: method; Morris: Options: oat (One at a Time) TODO: only one and conflicts with sobol

vini.description: PSO: Options: zero, lhs2011, random2011, lhs2007, random2007, default

wait_generations.description: RGenoud: If no improvement in waitGenerations of generations, then exit

xover_dist_idx.description: NSGA2: Crossover Distribution Index (large values give higher probabilities of offspring close to parent)

name.description: Name of the workflow step. This is commonly the measure name.

display_name.description: Display name for the workflow step.

measure_type.description: Type of measure to be run.

measure_definition_class_name.description: The class name as defined in the measure.rb file.

measure_definition_directory.description: Relative directory to the measure.rb file.

measure_definition_directory_local.description: Full path to the measure directory.

measure_definition_display_name.description: The display name of the measure as defined in the measure.rb.

measure_definition_name.description: The measure name (method) of the measure as defined in the measure.rb.

measure_definition_name_xml.description: The measure name as defined in the measure.xml. TODO: this should be deprecated.

arguments.description: List of measure arguments that are not used as variables.

argument_base_def.description: Details of the argument that is "tagged" as a variable for the problem. The argument is the measure argument.

display_name.description: Dispany name of the measure argument. This is user-defined.

display_name_short.description: A shorter display name for an argument. This field is typically used for graphs and table exports.

name.description: The machine name of the measure argument. This is typically the snake case field defined in the measure.xml.

value_type.description: The variable type of the value that is being  set.

value.description: The value to set the measure argument. Note that if the argument is within a variable, then the value is not used.

default_value.description: The default value for the argument. This is typically used in user interfaces.

uncertainty_def.description: Container for holding the uncertainty description.

name.description: Name of the uncertainty attribute such as lower bound, mean, standard deviation, etc.

values_and_weights.description: If the variable is discrete, then the list of values and weights for each option.

weight.description: Weight of the discrete value when being sampled.

variable_def.title: variables
variable_def.description: List of variables for the problem.

display_name.description: Display name of the variable. This is user-defined.

display_name_short.description: A shorter display name for the variable. This is typically used for graphs and table exports.

variable.description: Is the variable a variable? This should always be true.

variable_type.description: The type of variable. Can be pivot or variable. If pivot, then the pivot variable is applied to all algorithm values.

minimum.description: The minimum value of the variable. This can be a string, double, or integer.

maximum.description: The maximum value of the variable. This can be a string, double, or integer.

relation_to_output.description: The minimum value of the variable. This can be a string, double, or integer.

static_value.description: The static value of the variable when it is not set by the algorithm.

version_uuid.description: UUID of the version of the variable.

workflow_index.description: Integer index of the workflow step.
